welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
Illustrator.js

JavaScript image processing library

----------------------- # Installation ```powershell # install with npm $ npm install illustrator.js # install with yarn $ yarn add illustrator.js ``` üéâ No build tools required! # Features * Illustrator is fast, powered by **[@napi-rs/canvas](https://github.com/Brooooooklyn/canvas)** üöÄ * Illustrator provides beginner friendly API ü§ì * TypeScript supported üí™ * Layers API üéöÔ∏è * Color utilities API üé® * Filters üì∏ * Tools such as eraser, shapes, text, etc. ‚öíÔ∏è * Image manipulation (crop, brightness, blur, sharpness, format conversion, compression and much more..) * Animation API (GIF) üòé and more... # Documentation **[https://illustrator.js.org](https://illustrator.js.org)** # npm **[https://www.npmjs.com/package/illustrator.js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/illustrator.js)** # Quick Example ## Creating GIF
Show code ```js // import import { Illustrator } from "illustrator.js"; import fs from "fs"; // create illustrator instance const illustrator = new Illustrator(512, 512); // colors array const colors = ["#FFFFFF", "#FF0000", "#FFFF00", "#FF00FF", "#00FF00", "#0000FF"]; // for a color in colors array, create new layer and fill the layer with that color for (const color of colors) { // create new layer const layer = illustrator.layers.createLayer({ name: color }); // create background color tool const bgTool = layer.tools.get("BackgroundColorTool"); // set fill color bgTool.setFillColor(color); // fill background bgTool.fill(0, 0, illustrator.width, illustrator.height); // render this tool to the layer bgTool.render(); } // get animation api const animation = illustrator.animation; // get all layers and transform to animation frame const layers = illustrator.layers.getAllLayers().map(m => ({ duration: 500, frame: m.layer })); // animation config, set repeat to infinite (or 0) and add our layers to frames animation.setRepeat(0).addFrames(layers); // render the frames const output = await animation.createAnimation(); // write the output file output.pipe(fs.createWriteStream("./animation.gif")); ``` #### Output Preview
## Other Examples Check out **[~/examples](https://github.com/DevAndromeda/illustrator.js/tree/main/examples)** for more. # Canvacord It may be hard to get simple things done via this library. Check out **[Canvacord](https://github.com/CesiumLabs/canvacord)** for beginner-friendly utility APIs, built with **Illustrator.js**. # Special thanks to üíñ [Brooooooklyn](https://github.com/Brooooooklyn) and the people behind [napi-rs](https://github.com/napi-rs). Illustrator.js is here only because of their hard work behind the projects under napi-rs. # Discord Join our official Discord support server: **[Join Now](https://discord.gg/uqB8kxh)** # Help us keep this project alive [![ko-fi](https://ko-fi.com/img/githubbutton_sm.svg)](https://ko-fi.com/G2G05KFHP)

image-manipulation.name: Image Manipulation

gif-animation.name: Creating GIF

triggered-animation.name: Triggered

methods.name: [iterator]
methods.description: Returns an iterable of entries in the map.

methods.name: entries
methods.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the map.

methods.name: keys
methods.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the map

methods.name: values
methods.description: Returns an iterable of values in the map

methods.name: adjustContrast
methods.description:
Adjust the contrast of this image.
`contrast` is the amount to adjust the contrast by.
Negative values decrease the contrast and positive values increase the contrast.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Performs a Gaussian blur on this image.
`sigma` is a measure of how much to blur by.

methods.name: brighten
methods.description:
Brighten the pixels of this image.
`value` is the amount to brighten each pixel by.
Negative values decrease the brightness and positive values increase it.

methods.name: crop
methods.description: Crop a cut-out of this image delimited by the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: filter3x3
methods.description: Filters this image with the specified 3x3 kernel.

methods.name: grayscale
methods.description:
Return a grayscale version of this image.
Returns `Luma` images in most cases. However, for `f32` images,
this will return a greyscale `Rgb/Rgba` image instead.

methods.name: huerotate
methods.description:
Hue rotate the supplied image.
`value` is the degrees to rotate each pixel by.
0 and 360 do nothing, the rest rotates by the given degree value.
just like the css webkit filter hue-rotate(180)

methods.name: invert
methods.description: Invert the colors of this image.

methods.name: jpeg
methods.description: default `quality` is 90

methods.name: jpegSync
methods.description: default `quality` is 90

methods.name: rawPixels
methods.description: Return this image's pixels as a native endian byte slice.

methods.name: rawPixelsSync
methods.description: Return this image's pixels as a native endian byte slice.

methods.name: resize
methods.description:
Resize this image using the specified filter algorithm.
The image is scaled to the maximum possible size that fits
within the bounds specified by `width` and `height`.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description:
Rotate with exif orientation
If the orientation param is not null,
the new orientation value will override the exif orientation value

methods.name: unsharpen
methods.description:
Performs an unsharpen mask on this image.
`sigma` is the amount to blur the image by.
`threshold` is a control of how much to sharpen.

methods.name: webp
methods.description:
The quality factor `quality_factor` ranges from 0 to 100 and controls the loss and quality during compression.
The value 0 corresponds to low quality and small output sizes, whereas 100 is the highest quality and largest output size.
https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/docs/api#simple_encoding_api

methods.name: webpSync
methods.description:
The quality factor `quality_factor` ranges from 0 to 100 and controls the loss and quality during compression.
The value 0 corresponds to low quality and small output sizes, whereas 100 is the highest quality and largest output size.
https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/docs/api#simple_encoding_api

methods.name: load
methods.description: Loads image source data

methods.name: loadImage
methods.description: Loads {@link IllustratorImage} from the given source

methods.name: createImage
methods.description: Creates `Image` instance

methods.name: loadImage
methods.description: Loads the given source into `Image` instance.
